alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 10:13PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...The Salcha and Chena Rivers. * WHEN...Through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall combined with ongoing snowmelt over the Salcha and Chena River Basins have already caused rapid rises along both the Salcha and Chena rivers. Additional rainfall of around 0.5 inches combined with ongoing snowmelt will produce excess runoff and may flood low lying areas on the Salcha and Chena Rivers. Water may encroach onto property and around prone cabins. Expect increased debris in the rivers and possible increased erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Reports from the public of water levels at or above bankfull as well as debris and trees in the water have been reported on the Salcha River 30 river miles upstream of the gage near the Richardson Highway bridge. Above bankfull water levels have been also been reported on the Chena River near Two Rivers. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Salcha or the Chena Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
